item.title: Duplicate `avahi` names and Linux machines"
item.description: I set up a Mac Mini (2018) running Ubuntu as a home server last year so I could run Plex, Channels, and possibly self-host a couple other applications (looking into bookmarks and ebooks for the moment). Since I don’t dabble too deeply in network setup, I didn’t want to set up a DNS server (I’ve read, “It’s always DNS” far too many times to want to deal with that), I left the job up to automatic network discovery… what used to be Rendezvous on OS X (now Bonjour), run by mDNS under the hood. On Linux, that service is provided by avahi.
